channel.title: Kicksecure breaks Firefox and KeepassXC
channel.description: I installed `kicksecure-cli` on my Debian 12 machine and it breaks latest Firefox-ESR and KeepassXC. On Firefox, some sites cause crash. Error message: `[Parent 1234, IPC I/O Parent] WARNING: process 53223 exit on signal 4: file ./ipc/chromium/src/base/process_util_posix.cc:264` KeepassXC error message: `illegal instructions (core dump)` Both fixed after purging all Kicksecure packages and reinstall `dbus`.

item.title: Kicksecure breaks Firefox and KeepassXC
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
Sorry for late reply.
Yes it is running on hardware and not a VM.
It is latest firefox-esr from Debian stable repo.

Read full topic

item.title: Kicksecure breaks Firefox and KeepassXC
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
On hardware, i.e. not a VM?

SteveK1978:

On Firefox, some sites cause crash. Error message: [Parent 1234, IPC I/O Parent] WARNING: process 53223 exit on signal 4: file ./ipc/chromium/src/base/process_util_posix.cc:264

Firefox from packages.debian.org? Simpleâ€¦

firefox

Or flatpak or something?

Do you know a website where this is reliably reproducible?

SteveK1978:

KeepassXC error message: illegal instructions (core dump)

I cannot reproduce this anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Kicksecure breaks Firefox and KeepassXC
item.dc:creator: SteveK1978
item.description:
I installed kicksecure-cli on my Debian 12 machine and it breaks latest Firefox-ESR and KeepassXC.
On Firefox, some sites cause crash. Error message: [Parent 1234, IPC I/O Parent] WARNING: process 53223 exit on signal 4: file ./ipc/chromium/src/base/process_util_posix.cc:264
KeepassXC error message: illegal instructions (core dump)
Both fixed after purging all Kicksecure packages and reinstall dbus.

Read full topic
